string.text:
A popular piece of meat in The Zone favoured over dog meals. Scientific studies have plenty samples already. 

%c[default]WARNING:
%c[255,238,153,26] Stalkers are advised not to eat raw meat as Chernobyl animals carry a high likelihood of passing along trichinellosis or brucellosis. Both wreak havoc on the body in the form of fever, fatigue and appetite loss. Visible signs of abscesses, fungal growth and tumors inside the animal body also mean that you should toss it.
Flesh meat

The most popular piece of meat in The Zone. Saturating and only little contaminated. Scientific studies have plenty samples already. 

%c[default]WARNING:
%c[255,238,153,26] Stalkers are advised not to eat raw meat as Chernobyl animals carry a high likelihood of passing along trichinellosis or brucellosis. Both wreak havoc on the body in the form of fever, fatigue and appetite loss. Visible signs of abscesses, fungal growth and tumors inside the animal body also mean that you should toss it.
Boar chop

Mutated dogs are being cooked into meals at the Skadovsk. The meat is a cheap alternative to the more popular boar. Scientific studies have plenty samples already. 

%c[default]WARNING:
%c[255,238,153,26] Stalkers are advised not to eat raw meat as Chernobyl animals carry a high likelihood of passing along trichinellosis or brucellosis. Both wreak havoc on the body in the form of fever, fatigue and appetite loss. Visible signs of abscesses, fungal growth and tumors inside the animal body also mean that you should toss it.
Dog meat

The pseudodog is being cooked into meals just like most mutants in The Zone. A popular choice among stalkers. The meat can be sold for scientific purposes also. 

%c[default]WARNING:
%c[255,238,153,26] Stalkers are advised not to eat raw meat as Chernobyl animals carry a high likelihood of passing along trichinellosis or brucellosis. Both wreak havoc on the body in the form of fever, fatigue and appetite loss. Visible signs of abscesses, fungal growth and tumors inside the animal body also mean that you should toss it.
Pseudodog meat

A stringy portion of Bloodsucker meat. Although the Bloodsucker is a fearsome beast the meat is traded at affordable costs since it is hard to cook this into anything tasty. The meat can be sold for scientific purposes also. 

%c[default]WARNING:
%c[255,238,153,26] Stalkers are advised not to eat raw meat as Chernobyl animals carry a high likelihood of passing along trichinellosis or brucellosis. Both wreak havoc on the body in the form of fever, fatigue and appetite loss. Visible signs of abscesses, fungal growth and tumors inside the animal body also mean that you should toss it.
Bloodsucker meat

Most men in The Zone consider it a cannibalistic and immoral act to eat any part of a Snork! In spite of this some bandits and mercenaries are actually eating roasted Snork hands to signal a baddass superiority among their faction members. The hand is most commonly sold scientific purposes. 

%c[default]WARNING:
%c[255,238,153,26] Stalkers are advised not to eat raw meat as Chernobyl animals carry a high likelihood of passing along trichinellosis or brucellosis. Both wreak havoc on the body in the form of fever, fatigue and appetite loss. Visible signs of abscesses, fungal growth and tumors inside the animal body also mean that you should toss it.
Snork hand

A heavy chunk of Chimera meat. Since the Chimera is considered one of the most dangerous creatures the meat is traded at high prices among veteran stalkers. The Skadovsk is able to cook this meat into what is commonly known as "the masculine meal" although few claim it to be better tasting than the boar. The meat can be sold for scientific purposes also. 

%c[default]WARNING:
%c[255,238,153,26] Stalkers are advised not to eat raw meat as Chernobyl animals carry a high likelihood of passing along trichinellosis or brucellosis. Both wreak havoc on the body in the form of fever, fatigue and appetite loss. Visible signs of abscesses, fungal growth and tumors inside the animal body also mean that you should toss it.
Chunk of Chimera meat

A good portion of the mutated rats body. A cheap and common delicacy among stalkers that is said to strengthen your heart when cooked in open fire. The meat can be sold for scientific purposes also. 

%c[default]WARNING:
%c[255,238,153,26] Stalkers are advised not to eat raw meat as Chernobyl animals carry a high likelihood of passing along trichinellosis or brucellosis. Both wreak havoc on the body in the form of fever, fatigue and appetite loss. Visible signs of abscesses, fungal growth and tumors inside the animal body also mean that you should toss it.
Tushkano meat

The mutated, swollen eye of the Flesh acquired a number of strange characteristics, the most useful of which is the ability to regenerate the lens. The specifics of the process are hitherto unknown, although such discovery would most certainly revolutionize modern medicine. You can play your part in scientific development by selling Flesh eyes to scientists for their experiments. 

%c[default]WARNING:
%c[255,238,153,26] Stalkers are advised not to eat raw meat as Chernobyl animals carry a high likelihood of passing along trichinellosis or brucellosis. Both wreak havoc on the body in the form of fever, fatigue and appetite loss. Visible signs of abscesses, fungal growth and tumors inside the animal body also mean that you should toss it.
Flesh eye
Hoofs of Boars can be used to produce various drugs, for example antiradation serums.
Boar leg

The resistance of mutant dogs' skin to electricity and chemical agents has long been the subject of scientific attention. Since the animal's tail is almost completely free of fat tissue, it is especially suited for lab examination.
Dog tail

The resistance of mutant dogs' skin to electricity and chemical agents has long been the subject of scientific attention. Since the animal's tail is almost completely free of fat tissue, it is especially suited for lab examination.
Psuedodog tail

Bloodsucker tentacles contain a special gland producing an enzyme capable of dissolving the skin and simultaneously preventing blood from clotting. Discovering the enzyme's composition could be the cornerstone of a whole series of great medical advances.
Bloodsucker jaw

Snork feet and legs contain a huge number of highly elastic tendons. This explains the beast's ability to make those unbelievably long jumps. Scientists still look for useful possibilities to use them, and they would be thankful for all help they get.
Snork leg
The horn of a Chimera. It's exact molecular composition is unknown, but it is known that it is as strong as diamonds, explaining the beasts capacity to rip apart a man even inside an armoured suit.
Chimera horn
The claw of a Chimera. It's exact molecular composition is unknown, but it is known that it is as strong as diamonds, explaining the beasts capacity to rip apart a man even inside an armoured suit.
Chimera claw
The head of a Tushkano mutant. Scientists wish to study these in order to help them identify what creature the Tushkano originated from.
Tushkano head
Controllers have mental powers and this mutated ability must be found somewhere in their brains. Scientists will pay for this tissue for thorough examination.
Controller brain tissue

Controllers seem to use their hands when attacking with their psychological powers. Maybe scientists are able to locate a physiological mutation in their hands that can relate to their mental attacks.
Controller hand
